choices.D: the Azure Active Directory Module for Windows PowerShell

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Office 365 subscription.

You need to prevent guest users from deleting channels from a Microsoft Teams team.

What should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
correct: Set-Team-GuestSetting -GroupId <TeamId> -DeleteChannelsAllowed $false

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/how-many-phone-numbers-can-you-get

User (subscriber) number
The number of phone numbers is equal to the total number of Domestic Calling Plan and/or Domestic and International Calling Plan licenses multiplied by 1.1 + 10 additional phone numbers.

Toll-free service number (no logic, just hope to remember from the site)
If there are 1-25 licenses then 5 telephone numbers are given.
If there are 26-49 licenses then 10 telephone numbers are given.
If there are 50-99 licenses then 20 telephone numbers are given.
If there are 100-149 licenses then 30 telephone numbers are given.
If there are 150-199 licenses then 40 telephone numbers are given.
If there are 200-499 licenses then 65 telephone numbers are given.
If there are 500-749 licenses then 90 telephone numbers are given.

comments.content:
Forgot to add for the Toll-Free service Number:
The number of licenses is equal to the total number of Phone System and Audio Conferencing licenses.
We can only hope the other 2 answers are not reasonable which is the case on this question.

discussion.content:
Domestic plan x 1.1 + 10:
(100 x 1.1 = 110) + 10 = 120
This one OK.

Who will try to memorize Toll numbers logic (because Microsoft doesn't tell us the formula)???

1. For **User Phone Numbers**, you have 100 Domestic Calling Plan licenses. The calculation is indeed $$100 \times 1.1 + 10 = 110 + 10 = 120$$. Therefore, the maximum number of user phone numbers you can acquire is **120**.

2. For **Toll-free Service Numbers**, for 100-149 licenses, 30 phone numbers are given. So, the maximum number of toll-free service numbers you can acquire is indeed **30**.

what a boring... 
call plan * 1.1 + 10 
call plan /25 * 5 then select the most near value
Answer is correct, however it is now more an MS-720 related question

The number of phone numbers is equal to the total number of Phone System and Audio Conferencing licenses and uses the following:
If there are 100-149 licenses then 30 telephone numbers are given.

questions.question_text:
Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription.
You need to create an auto attendant from the Microsoft Teams admin center.
Which object must be associated to the auto attendant?

comments.content: This man is correct! - Pilot program too, so you need to assign licenses first of course ;)

discussion.content:
Answer should be D - Calling Plans do not require a Voice Routing Policy, but an additional license:
Set-AzureADUserLicense - Used to apply PhoneSystem and Calling Plan license
Set-CsOnlineVoiceUser - Used to apply Microsoft Phone Number to the User
Set-CSUser - Enables the User for EnterpriseVoice
Correct is D - assign license, assign number and emergency location, enable for enterprise voice

comments.content: I'm with you on this one, though the question (as is typical from Microsoft) is a little ambiguous in their awful wording. They say you need to make calls to THE PTSN, not THROUGH the PTSN so D seems to be correct.

discussion.content:
Answer should be D with the selection provided.

But, the Set-CsOnllineVoiceUser & Set-CSUser cmdlet had been deprecated, and replaced by Set-CsPhoneNumberAssignment for phone number assignment and EV enabling.

So, this question should be updated with new PS cmdlets:

D: Set-AzureADUserLicense, Set-CsPhoneNumberAssignment
Was on exam 19.08.2022
Correct , in exam on 25th of July 2022
On Exam 28.02.22
D. Set-AzureADUserLicense, Set-CsOnlineVoiceUser, and Set-CSUser
I vote for D on this one.

B: Assigning your Teams users an online voice routing policy enables those users to receive and to place phone calls to the public switched telephone network by using your on-premises SIP trunks.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/skype/grant-csonlinevoiceroutingpolicy?view=skype-ps

comments.content:
No: Online Voice Routing policies are ONLY for direct routing solutions
This question specifically calls out Microsoft Calling
i think he agrees with you. He is simply saying that b has to do with onpremise sip turn aka directing routing configuration,

discussion.content: D is correct. Grant-CsOnlineVoiceRoutingPolicy is only for Direct Routing and the question says they are using a Microsoft Calling Plan.

comments.content: But the Project is using a Calling Plan and not Direct routing..

From https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/skype/grant-csonlinevoiceroutingpolicy?view=skype-ps:

"Online voice routing policies are used in Microsoft Phone System Direct Routing scenarios. Assigning your Teams users an online voice routing policy enables those users to receive and to place phone calls to the public switched telephone network by using your on-premises SIP trunks."
Grant-CsOnlineVoiceRoutingPolicy is for direct rounting, here says "pilot project will use a Microsoft Calling Plan" so B is wrong and D is right

discussion.content: B is correct - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/skype/grant-csonlinevoiceroutingpolicy?view=skype-ps

questions.question_text:
You plan to implement a pilot project on Phone System for 100 users.
The pilot project will use a Microsoft Calling Plan.
You need to ensure that the users can establish calls to the PSTN.
Which cmdlets should you run?
questions.answer_description:
A Microsoft Calling plan requires an additional license. The three cmdlets in this answer assign a phone system license to the user, assigns a phone number to the user and enables the user for Enterprise Voice.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/calling-plans-for-office-365 https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/set-up-calling-plans

The employees are leaving the company.
You need to ensure that the phone numbers can be reassigned to other employees as quickly as possible.

discussion.content:

comments.content: Agreed, Set-csuser cmdlet is the only way to change direct routing number. This cannot be done in TAC.

yes in 2023 & 2024 you can now do it in TAC....Go to the Microsoft Teams admin center.
Click Users > Manage users.
Select the user to whom you want to assign a phone number.
Under Account, click Edit.
Under Assign phone number, select Direct Routing from the Phone number type drop-down menu.
Enter the phone number that you want to assign to the user.
Click Apply.
the PS CMD also changed to Set-CsPhoneNumberAssignment -Identity cq1@contoso.com -PhoneNumber +14255551225 -PhoneNumberType DirectRouting
also just to add i think this question will change it will no longer have the set-cs user cmd

discussion.content:
Found this Microsoft Answer for User2

comments.content: in the last command at the end should be DirectRouting

get-csonlineuser | where-object lineuri -like 'tel:+48XXXXXXXXX' | select userprincipalname, displayname [check who has this number]

Remove-CsPhoneNumberAssignment -Identity xx@company.com -PhoneNumber +48XXXXXXXXX -PhoneNumberType DirectRouting [remove number from user XX]

Set-CsPhoneNumberAssignment -Identity yy@company.com -PhoneNumber +48XXXXXXXXX [assign number to user YY]
